thread.title: One Direction release 'Perfect' from forthcoming album
thread.title_full: One Direction release 'Perfect' from forthcoming album - UPI.com

author: Annie Martin
title: One Direction release 'Perfect' from forthcoming album
text:
1 of 5 | License Photo LONDON, Oct. 16 (UPI) -- One Direction released the single "Perfect" from their forthcoming album Friday.
The track is the second single to debut from the band's new record, Morning in the A.M. , and was preceded by the song "Drag Me Down."
"Perfect" was reportedly inspired by Harry Styles ' relationship with singer Taylor Swift . The pair were linked in 2012, and the song includes the lyrics, "And if you like cameras flashing every time we go out/(Oh, yeah)/And if you're looking for someone to write your breakup songs about/Baby, I'm perfect."
Swift is well known for writing songs about her romances, and is said to have penned several about Styles on her album 1989 . "Style" is believed to be about the 21-year-old English pop star.
Morning in the A.M. will be the band's first release without Zayn Malik . The 22-year-old singer left One Direction in March, and subsequently signed a solo deal with RCA Records. His former bandmates will take a hiatus to pursue their own solo careers starting in March 2016.
